intro: Sesuvium edmonstonei, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red sesuvium, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. It is adapted to withstand high salinity and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable plant in botanical studies and horticulture.
